captions.text: The other one? There are two of them?
Even you, with your great speed couldn't stop both of them.

While I on the other hand
could stop them with my detonator.
Wait what did you say about me?
I said, even with your great speed you couldn't stop all of them.
Are these the missiles you were talking about, Lex?
Yes. I said those are the ones.
I mean I flew around the Earth a few times but these are the only giant missiles I could find.
But you said I couldn't possibly catch 'em both so these must not be the
Yes, those are the ones. Alright, you win.
Please, just get them out of here.
Made sure they put Luther away..
Made out with Lois for a little bit...
Flew out into space, smiled for the camera.
Turns out Luther had this chunk of Kryptonite that would have totally ruined
me if he would have just whipped it out..

Yeah but for some reason instead
he just told me his evil plan first and

then tried to trick me into finding the
Kryptonite myself.
You know what I would've done?
I would've thrown a Bat-a-rang at him.
Oh I would have some kind of Bat-missile defense gadget on my belt

You use that utility belt scenario for every
situation
What's wrong with my utility belt?
Oh nothing. Nothing's wrong with it.
Just uh, whenever you get a uh..

"Fly so fast it reverses time itself"
gadget on your belt...
I know, you say that A LOT.
I carry things on my belt, 'cause I'm Batman.

comments.author: labobo

comments.text:
They never specifically said that Lex *didn't* have a detonator, but if he 
did, it was hidden well enough that even Superman couldn't find it.  The 
main reason why Lex mentioned the detonator, however, was to force Superman 
to search for it, thereby finding the kryptonite in the lead box, (which he 
could have protected himself from by just closing the box again.)  So yes. 
 This one makes a good point.  It's still one of my all-time favorite 
movies though.

comments.author: Mathew Nelson

comments.text:
+Trekfreek Something is definitely wrong with you. You could have easily 
made an internet search and found several articles about how memory works.

Your logic is flawed.

Tell me how does that make you feel?
comments.author: labobo

comments.text:
+labobo First off I'm not the one acting all childish over a silly video... 
it is you who needs to grow up. Second memories do not degrade over the 
years, who ever told you that is lying. I'm an accountant, ideal with 
numbers clients and information on a daily bases. I don't have a great 
memory but I don't for get any thing I learned. Memory is like software for 
your brain, you always have access to it as long as you remember the key 
words and phrases that will locate and open the files of your memories.

Now the point is in the original ending Superman used his powers to locate 
the fictional detonator and wound up exposing himself to the kryptonite! 
GET IT NOW? Now if superman can fly faster then light why didn't he just to 
what HISHE suggested instead of being a dumb ass and believing an 
established liar (Lex told a lie to trick Superman into coming to his hide 
out). Try watching the movie before watching a fans alternate ending!
comments.author: Trekfreek

comments.text:
+Trekfreek What is wrong with you? My original comment was for this video 
not the original superman movie.

I process more data than most people per day. That superman movie I watched 
several years ago. I haven't watched it since. I do not remember the 
details. Biologically, in most humans, memories degrade over time. You 
could describe it as a picture losing its detail over time.
Everything from accessing the memory to not accessing it at all will change 
the memory.

Please just grow up. Start use your brain, Be helpful to society.
comments.author: labobo

comments.text:
+labobo No shit Sherlock. Watch the original movie... It Too mentioned a 
detonator and Superman looked for it and then said "You think you can hide 
it from me by incasing it in led?!"
Now let me explain it to you, for you obviously have the attention span of 
a 4 year old, Lex didn't have a detonator! HE LIED to get Superman too open 
up the led box containing the kryptonite! Get it?! You see HISHE expects 
people to have actually watch the movie so that they don't have to show the 
original ending to explain their joke. GO WATCH SUPERMAN (the movie)!!!! 
and pay attention!!!
comments.author: Trekfreek
